chargeHist.descr: Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R. Holden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Obtain Deer Hunting Required Approval, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.024(1).
  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear [Modifiers: PTAC - DNR], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).
  • Resist Conservation Warden, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.951.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The fine and costs shall be paid to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $250.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022..Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
The crossbow that was seized shall be forfeited to the DNR.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

The jail sentence shall begin no later than August 23, 2022 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony R. Holden

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

2:16 PM Defendant Anthony R. Holden in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Anthony R. Holden. Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Subject to the plea in counts 1, 2 & 3.  Court dismisses and read in count 4. Court dismisses 21FO402, 21FO403 & 21FO404.   Waive reading of Information.  Plea of no contest to Counts 1, 2 & 3. Victim notification has been complied.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 & 3.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Bauer.  Statement by Anthony Holden.  Court orders a $1,000.00 fine plus costs in counts 1 and 2. DNA sample and surcharge; revocation of all Chapter 29 privileges for three years; forfeiture of cross bow.  Count 3 - court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; four days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than August 23, 2022.  The fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $250.00 a month beginning August 1, 2022 any unpaid costs are 1 day in jail for every $10.00 unpaid. - rt
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

08:38 AM Defendant Anthony R. Holden in court with attorney Joseph L Bauer.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   The state requested signature bond in the amount of $2,000.00 with conditions of: booking. Attty Bauer objects to amount of bond.  Court sets bond as state requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled April 20, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. Court takes note that 21FO402-404 is tracking with case. ba
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
Initial appearance on March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
